Reviews.Title: Wireless Surveillance System
Reviews.Author: James Arquitt
Reviews.Content: Couldn't use because signal strength is too short.2 rooms max W/flickering.I use camera hooked to cable not wireless.

Reviews.Title: Not enough info
Reviews.Author: dschworak
Reviews.Content: I have no idea how good or bad this product is because there was no info stating that it does not work on anything higher than Windows XP and I have Windows Vista and Windows 7.It is not easy to get Windows XP on a device that was intended for Windows Vista and without drivers for Windows Vista or Windows 7, it doesn't work at all.

Reviews.Title: No Windows 7 support or no web site for more info/support
Reviews.Author: Jason Sherry "IzKen/Izzy"
Reviews.Content: The documentation states support for Windows 2000 and Windows 2003, so it didn't claim to support Windows 7, but given that it's 2011 I figured I would give it a shot.The provided drivers did install but didn't work, even in compatibility mode. The box and documentation has no company name or model number, bad sign. I was able to find the model # (RC531A-CM801CWAS1-4) on geeks.com, who is the provider of this product.After spending about an hour searching the Internet I was able to find no one who has been able to get it to work with Vista, Windows 7 x86 or x64. In addition, many people had issues getting it to work on multiple Windows XP systems. So the provided drivers are very poorly written and don't work with any operating system developed in the last eight years.Don't waste your time and money on this product. The idea behind it is good, but without drivers it's useless unless you want to hook up a composite/RCA monitor to it and watch the live feeds only. The only way to record video is on a computer.
